column4: Question:  simple bash scripting redirection with >    how to redirect to a file and still display on stdout?
use tee
simple example of how to use tee please ?
e.g touch foo ; echo bar | tee bleh.txt
heh sorry echo bar | tee foo
anyway you get the idea...
tee = cool
did you read the wiki page I posted from ubotu?
on one laptop, synaptic finds freenx.  on my other laptop, package not found...  thanks for the debs link tho
oh - that's odd
and you're welcome
all repositories are enabled, and both are even on the same network.  apt-get doesnt find the package either
bizarre
I imagine you might need to edit /etc/hosts
I edited /etc/hosts, how can I apply those changes?
he left :/
the fridge is definitely on-topic :)
as was jdub's interview for that matter *grin*
not sure, but I think pgrep -u username will return processes of that user
hmm or maybe -U  ( man pgrep)
it's all the same username, but I think I found a way to do it by tty.   kill -9 `ps -t <tty> -o "pid="`
kill $(pgrep -u username sshd)    ?
looks like pkill would also work..
